item.title: Coronavirus: No 'single leap to freedom', minister warns
item.description: "Extreme caution" will be needed when the UK eases lockdown, Grant Shapps says as he announces transport measures.

item.title: Little Richard: Rock 'n' roll pioneer dies
item.description: The self-styled "king and queen of rock 'n' roll" - who inspired Elvis and The Beatles - dies at 87.

item.title: Coronavirus: China offers to help North Korea fight pandemic
item.description: President Xi Jinping expresses concern about the threat to its neighbour, and offers to help.

item.title: Coronavirus: Garden centres in England to reopen next week
item.description: Stores following social distancing can reopen from Wednesday, a senior government source says.

item.title: Coronavirus in the UK: The first 100 days
item.description: How the government's policy has shifted from the first recorded case to the PM being treated in ICU.

item.title: Coronavirus: Key safeguards needed for schools to reopen - unions
item.description: Education unions say they want scientific evidence it is safe for teachers and pupils to return.

item.title: Coronavirus: Chinese official admits health system weaknesses
item.description: China says it will improve public health systems after criticism of its early response to the virus.

item.title: Migrant crossings: 227 people intercepted amid lockdown spike
item.description: At least 227 people attempt to cross the English Channel in two days, the Home Office says.

item.title: Coronavirus rules 'an enormous ask', says first minister
item.description: Mark Drakeford said "we should all be anxious" about how long lockdown can be sustained.

item.title: Coronavirus: Russia swaps Victory Day parade for air show
item.description: The Red Square parade was cancelled because of the pandemic, but in neighbouring Belarus the parade went ahead as planned.

item.title: Coronavirus: Andy Serkis reads entire Hobbit live online for charity
item.description: More than 650,000 watch the Gollum actor narrate Tolkien's fantasy classic in one 11-hour sitting.

item.title: Coronavirus: What could a socially-distanced bar look like?
item.description: How bars and restaurants could look when coronavirus restrictions are eased.

item.title: Ramadan: Young Muslims share coronavirus lockdown diaries
item.description: Three young Muslims share their experiences on what Ramadan has been like so far during life in lockdown.

item.title: Penguin chicks and other stories you may have missed
item.description: Some of the stories from around the world that you may have missed this week.

item.title: Coronavirus: Bread and cake tips from a self-isolating baker
item.description: Ray normally runs his family bakery, Rinkoffs, but is currently staying at home with his wife.

item.title: RTX Voice: Noise-destroying tech put to the test
item.description: Two noise-cancelling AI systems - Nvidia RTX Voice and Krisp - are put to the test.

item.title: Coronavirus: Huntington's care in lockdown
item.description: Danielle's mum Lisa is in the final stage of Huntington's and needs full-time care.

item.title: Norfolk Island morepork owls: Major breakthrough for rare species
item.description: Two fledglings may have safeguarded the future of the Norfolk Island morepork owl.

item.title: VE Day celebrations: The UK marks 75th anniversary
item.description: An RAF flypast and a national minute's silence are among the events marking the 75th anniversary.

item.title: Chvrches singer Lauren Mayberry on lockdown life in LA
item.description: Lauren Mayberry talks to the BBC's Unlocked podcast about lockdown in LA, social media and abusive relationships.

item.title: Obituary: Little Richard, a flamboyant pioneer
item.description: The self-styled "king and queen of rock 'n' roll" - who inspired Elvis and The Beatles - dies at 87.

item.title: Coronavirus: Six money-saving ideas for lockdown and beyond
item.description: Millions of people are facing pay cuts or less work, so how can you make your money go further?

item.title: Coronavirus: Belarus WW2 parade defies pandemic and upstages Putin
item.description: Belarus goes ahead with a Victory Day parade but in Russia coronavirus forced its cancellation.

item.title: Coronavirus: Compulsory vaccines in the UK and other rumours fact-checked
item.description: A round-up of what's been debunked includes rumours about mandatory coronavirus vaccines and patents.

item.title: Coronavirus: How they tried to curb Spanish flu pandemic in 1918
item.description: Face masks, fresh air and porridge - how people tried to curb a deadly flu pandemic in 1918.

item.title: Coronavirus: My lockdown hen party was virtually as good as the real thing
item.description: A bride-to-beâ€™s friends and family organised the surprise event to replace the one they originally had planned.

item.title: Coronavirus: How is Suffolk's Little America coping in lockdown?
item.description: How are the communities that rely so heavily on the US airbases coping under lockdown?

item.title: Coronavirus: Challenge of reshaping UK cities after lockdown
item.description: Replacing cars with bikes or walking will cut infection and address climate change, say campaigners.

item.title: Watford third team to oppose Premier League neutral venue proposals
item.description: Watford become the third team to publicly oppose the use of neutral venues when Premier League football returns.

item.title: 'I feel fresher and healthier' - Hamilton enjoying parts of F1 break
item.description: Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton says he feels certain benefits from his enforced time away from Formula 1.

item.title: Dresden put entire squad in isolation - a week before German football restarts
item.description: Dynamo Dresden, who play in the second tier of German Football, have put their entire squad and coaching staff into two-week isolation after recording two new coronavirus cases.

item.title: Pro14 season resumption planned for late August
item.description: Plans are being considered to resume a curtailed Pro14 season on 22 August following the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Gossip - Tottenham leading Man Utd in race for Meunier
item.description: Tottenham are ahead of Manchester United in the race for Thomas Meunier as the Red Devils consider replacements for David de Gea.

item.title: Coronavirus: Eight things that have kept us going in lockdown
item.description: Coronavirus has forced people in Britain to radically change the way they live their lives. Here are eight things that have helped us cope.

item.title: Coronavirus UK map: How many confirmed cases are there in your area?
item.description: Key graphics explaining how coronavirus has spread in the UK and the government's response.

item.title: Coronavirus: Will over-70s have to stay in lockdown?
item.description: Will the over-70s be treated differently to the rest of the population?

item.title: Coronavirus: Why might the R number be higher in Scotland?
item.description: The R-value is at the heart of decisions on easing the lockdown - so why might it be different north of the border?

item.title: Coronavirus: Why did the UK need 100,000 tests a day?
item.description: What are the tests for coronavirus, who are they for and how do they work?

item.title: The FBI said I was my parents' stolen baby - but I found the truth
item.description: Foundling Paul Fronczak was given to a family whose baby had been stolen - but was he really their son?
